abstract: Brazilian authorities announce first arrest related to gang-rape of 16-year-old girl in Sao Joao shanty town in Rio de Janeiro; police are continuing to search for over 30 suspects; crime, which has sparked public demonstrations following graphic Twitter postings of unconscious, naked teen, has underscored Brazil's deep-rooted problem of violence against women.
lead_paragraph: A 16-year-old girl told the authorities that she had been attacked by more than 30 men, prompting outrage as the government vowed to combat crimes against women.

headline.main: First Arrest Made in Gang Rape Case in Brazil
headline.print_headline: First Arrest Made After Gang Rape of Teenager in Brazil

snippet: A 16-year-old girl told the authorities that she had been attacked by more than 30 men, prompting outrage as the government vowed to combat crimes against women.
